name: mediamtx
description: Zero-dependency real-time media server and media proxy

repo.name: mediamtx
repo.description: Ready-to-use SRT / WebRTC / RTSP / RTMP / LL-HLS / MPEG-TS / RTP media server and media proxy that allows to read, publish, proxy, record and playback video and audio streams.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity on what the package does, but README lacks inline installation/usage instructions and relies entirely on external documentation links.
readme.top_issue: No installation or quick start instructions in the README itself - users must click through to external documentation to get started

injection_risks.description: The filepath.Abs function can potentially introduce a path traversal vulnerability if the input is not properly sanitized.
The http.Get function does not validate the URL, which could lead to a SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) vulnerability if user input is used to construct the URL.
The http.Get function does not validate the URL, which could lead to a SSRF (Server-Side Request Forgery) vulnerability if user input is used to construct the URL.

critical_findings: Potential SSRF vulnerability in hlsjsdownloader/main.go and mtxrpicamdownloader/main.go
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and input validation issues, but no critical secrets or error exposure vulnerabilities were found.

common_complaints: Performance degradation in recent updates causing frame drops
Lack of dynamic source configuration without external binaries
sentiment.summary: Community shows active engagement with performance concerns and feature requests, but limited maintainer interaction visible in recent issues.

red_flags: requests for additional information can be repetitive
communication.summary: The maintainer provides generally helpful and technically detailed responses, but could improve in terms of clarity, patience, and welcomingness to create a more supportive environment for users and contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-13)
215 open issues with zero closed in past 6 months indicates no active triage
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged pull requests in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process is stalled
No pull request activity despite high issue count
positive_signals: Recent commit activity (2026-01-13) suggests some minimal development
maintenance.summary: The project appears abandoned with a large backlog of unresolved issues, no recent maintenance activity, and no active contributors despite a very recent commit timestamp.

project_metrics.description: Ready-to-use SRT / WebRTC / RTSP / RTMP / LL-HLS / MPEG-TS / RTP media server and media proxy that allows to read, publish, proxy, record and playback video and audio streams.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation provides a good overview of the package's features, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and quick start example
Communication: requests for additional information can be repetitive
Security: Potential SSRF vulnerability in hlsjsdownloader/main.go and mtxrpicamdownloader/main.go
